intro: Cryptocarya edanoi, commonly known as the New Zealand kōhanga, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocados. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. Cryptocarya edanoi is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
